newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Fianna Fail to win Irish election - poll.
newsitem.headline: Fianna Fail to win Irish election - poll.

text.p: Ireland's Fianna Fail party is heading for a narrow victory over Prime Minister John Bruton's rulng Rainbow coalition in Ireland's election, according to an exit poll carried out by the Irish Times.
But it was not clear from the poll whether Fianna Fail will win enough votes with its Progressive Democrats ally to form a two-party government, the poll said.
The survey, carried out by MRBI among 1,239 electors, showed Fianna Fail, led by Bertie Ahern, winning 44 percent of votes and the Progressive Democrats four percent.
Bruton's Fine Gael won 27 percent and its Labour Party and Democratic Left allies eight and three percent respectively. Other small parties polled 11 percent of votes.
"It is not yet clear whether Fianna Fail and the Progressive Democrats will have sufficient seats to form a government. The outgoing government has no chance of being elected," the newspaper said.
